item.title: 凯雷集团季度利润因私募股权交易增长
item.description: 资产管理公司凯雷集团周五公布的财报显示，其第四季度利润实现增长，这得益于私募股权部门的交易收入以及信贷和二级市场业务的稳健收益。【原文：Asset manager Carlyle Group posted a rise in fourth-quarter profit on Friday, helped by income from deals at its private-equity arm and solid gains across its credit and secondaries businesses.】

item.title: 百健预测年度利润超预期，因乐康比销售增长
item.description: 百健公司周五预测2026年利润将超华尔街预期，其信心源于新型药物及阿尔茨海默病治疗药物乐可美（Leqembi）的需求增长，而老一代多发性硬化症药物正面临廉价仿制药的冲击。【原文：Biogen forecast 2026 profit above Wall Street estimates on Friday, banking on demand for newer medicines and its Alzheimer's treatment Leqembi as older multiple sclerosis drugs battle pressure from cheaper versions.】

item.title: 据消息人士透露，墨西哥国家石油公司将天然气和凝析油田的合同授予了斯利姆旗下公司。
item.description: 知情人士透露，墨西哥国有企业墨西哥石油公司已将一座原油和天然气田的开发合同授予卡洛斯·斯利姆控制的企业。此举标志着这位商业巨头进一步巩固了其在能源领域的布局。【原文：Mexican state company Pemex has awarded a contract for a crude oil and natural gas field to a company controlled by Carlos Slim, three sources with knowledge of the matter said, as the tycoon further strengthens his presence in the energy sector.】

item.title: 投资者对国防类股票持谨慎态度，因特朗普对CEO薪酬和股息实施新限制
item.description: 国防承包商的投资者担忧，白宫限制首席执行官薪酬、股息和股票回购的命令可能降低股东回报，并阻碍企业吸引顶尖管理人才的能力。【原文：Investors in defense contractors worry that a White House order restricting CEO pay, dividends and stock buybacks could reduce returns for shareholders and impede the companies' ability to attract the best executives.】

item.title: 华尔街本周展望：科技股震荡阴云笼罩市场，经济数据洪流将至
item.description: 人工智能引发的科技巨头领域洗牌，将在未来一周持续令股市投资者如坐针毡，而密集发布的经济数据或将使市场焦点转向经济健康状况。【原文：An artificial intelligence-driven shakeout in the heavyweight technology sector is set to keep stock investors on edge in the coming week while a barrage of data could shift focus to the health of the economy.】

item.title: 独家：知情人士称花旗集团计划今年完成同意令相关工作
item.description: 据两位知情人士透露，花旗集团高管对今年晚些时候完成重大监管处罚（即同意令）的合规工作越来越乐观。这两位人士因涉及机密监管信息而要求匿名。【原文：Citigroup executives are becoming more optimistic that they will be able to finish compliance work on major regulatory punishments, known as consent orders, later this year, according to two sources familiar with the situation who declined to be identified discussing confidential supervisory information.】

item.title: TikTok被控违反欧盟网络内容法规，应用程序或需调整
item.description: 欧盟科技监管机构周五指控社交媒体应用TikTok通过其成瘾性功能违反欧盟在线内容规则，并告知该平台可能需要修改应用设计，否则将面临最高相当于母公司字节跳动全球营业额6%的罚款。【原文：Social media app TikTok was charged by EU tech regulators on Friday with breaching EU online content rules through its addictive features and was told that it may have to change the design of its app or risk a fine of as much as 6% of owner ByteDance's global turnover.】

item.title: 土耳其正逐步限制未成年人使用社交媒体，此举符合全球趋势
item.description: 土耳其正着手限制未成年人使用社交媒体，本周一份议会报告呼吁采取包括年龄验证和内容过滤在内的一系列广泛措施，该国由此加入了寻求加强管控的国家行列。【原文：Turkey is laying the groundwork to restrict social media access for minors with a parliamentary report this week calling for broad measures including age verification and content filtering, joining a growing list of countries seeking tighter controls.】

item.title: 全球软件与数据企业股价下跌，因对人工智能颠覆的担忧加剧了市场对6000亿美元资本支出计划的忧虑。
item.description: 全球科技股和数据股周五再度下跌，市场暴跌势头未见缓解，投资者担忧新型强大人工智能模型对这些公司业务的影响，以及超大规模企业今年计划投入数十亿美元部署新技术。【原文：Global technology and data stocks slid again on Friday, as a rout showed no signs of abating on worries over the impact of powerful new AI models on their business and the billions hyperscalers plan to spend on their tech roll out this year.】

item.title: 解读：全球车企因电动汽车政策回撤蒙受550亿美元损失
item.description: 过去一年间，全球汽车制造商累计计提约550亿美元减值准备。在特朗普政府治下的美国市场竞争加剧、中国市场价格战频发以及欧洲市场车型结构日益复杂的三重压力下，车企纷纷缩减电动汽车发展目标。【原文：Global carmakers have booked some $55 billion in writedowns in the past year as they scale back electric vehicle ambitions on a tough U.S. market under President Donald Trump, price wars in China and a more complex mix of vehicle types in Europe.】

item.title: 科技股抛售拖累美股基金资金流入放缓
item.description: 截至2月4日当周，美国股票基金需求有所放缓，因投资者对软件股抛售保持谨慎，尽管礼来公司和超级微电脑公司强劲的财报提供了一定支撑。【原文：U.S. equity funds witnessed an easing of demand in the week through February 4 on caution over a selloff in software stocks, although strong earnings from Eli Lilly and Super Micro Computer offered some support.】

item.title: 亚马逊股价下跌，科技巨头的人工智能支出计划令投资者担忧
item.description: 亚马逊股价周五盘前交易中下跌8%，此前该公司庞大的资本支出计划加剧了投资者对科技巨头在人工智能领域挥霍无度的担忧。【原文：Amazon shares dropped 8% in premarket trading on Friday after the company's hefty capital expenditure plans deepened investor worries over Big Tech's spending spree on artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 联合国粮农组织称1月全球食品价格进一步回落
item.description: 联合国粮食及农业组织周五表示，1月份全球食品价格连续第五个月下跌，其中乳制品、糖类和肉类产品价格跌幅最为显著。【原文：World food prices fell for a fifth straight month in January, led by declines in dairy, sugar and meat products, the United Nations' Food and Agriculture Organization said on Friday.】

item.title: 英伟达供应商和硕高管称人工智能并非泡沫
item.description: 台湾电子制造商和硕董事长林明哲周五表示，人工智能并非泡沫，2026年人工智能相关订单增长将超过去年。【原文：Artificial intelligence is not a bubble, and 2026 AI-related order growth will be more than last year, Simon Lin, the chairman of Taiwanese electronics manufacturer Wistron , said on Friday.】

item.title: 华为支持的Aito与阿联酋经销商合作，进军中东市场
item.description: 中国汽车制造商赛力斯周五宣布，其电动汽车品牌爱驰已与阿布扎比经销商集团Performance Plus Motors达成战略协议，以拓展中东市场。【原文：Chinese automaker Seres said on Friday that its electric vehicle brand Aito has struck a strategic deal with Abu Dhabi-based dealer group Performance Plus Motors to expand into the Middle East market.】

item.title: 通过收购彪马股权，中国安踏体育公司试图与耐克和阿迪达斯同台竞技
item.description: 安踏体育作为中国领先的运动服饰企业，正通过收购驱动的全球布局加速进军国际市场，包括上周斥资18亿美元收购德国彪马29%股权的交易。【原文：Anta Sports , China's top sportswear company, has leaped onto the international stage with an acquisition-driven global portfolio, including last week's $1.8 billion deal for a 29% stake in Germany's Puma .】

item.title: 诺和诺德股价反弹，因FDA锁定非法仿制药
item.description: 美国食品和药物管理局承诺将严厉打击未经批准药品的大规模营销行为。【原文：The U.S. Food and Drug Administration pledged to address mass-marketing of unapproved drugs.】

item.title: 欧洲、亚洲引领全球股票基金资金流入，投资者削减美国科技股配置
item.description: 全球股票基金资金流入强劲，欧洲和亚洲市场领涨，凸显出投资者正积极推进资产配置多元化——他们试图降低对波动剧烈的美国科技股的持仓，并将风险分散至其他市场。【原文：Global equity funds saw strong inflows led by Europe and Asia, underscoring a diversification push as investors sought to reduce exposure to volatile U.S. technology shares and spread risk across other markets.】

item.title: 欧洲STOXX 600指数因Stellantis业绩下滑而下跌；科技股成为焦点
item.description: 欧洲股市周五下跌，本周波动剧烈，投资者对软件公司持谨慎态度，加上一批企业财报令人失望，其中汽车制造商Stellantis是最新案例，这使得本周收盘表现平淡。【原文：European shares dropped on Friday, and were set to log a subdued end to a volatile week dominated by investor caution around software companies and a batch of disappointing corporate earnings, with carmaker Stellantis being the latest.】

item.title: Stellantis股价暴跌14.4%后停牌，公司宣布计提265亿美元减值准备
item.description: 斯泰兰蒂斯汽车公司周五股价暴跌14.4%后，其在米兰上市的股票暂停交易。此前该公司宣布，由于缩减电动汽车开发计划，将在2025年下半年计提约222亿欧元（265亿美元）的费用。【原文：Milan-listed shares of Stellantis were halted from trading after falling 14.4% on Friday, after the carmaker booked charges of around 22.2 billion euros ($26.5 billion) in the second half of 2025, as it scales down plans for electric-vehicle development.】

item.title: 德国基民盟考虑对16岁以下青少年实施社交媒体年龄限制
item.description: 德国基民盟高层人士表示，随着全球范围内加强限制的趋势日益明显，该党正考虑限制16岁以下儿童使用社交媒体平台。德国总理候选人弗里德里希·默茨领导的基民盟正考虑实施这一措施。【原文：German Chancellor Friedrich Merz's Christian Democrat Union is considering limiting access to social media platforms for children under the age of 16, senior party members said, as a global movement towards tighter restrictions gathers pace.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称日本三井集团即将入股卡塔尔液化天然气项目
item.description: 知情人士向路透社透露，日本三井物产即将收购卡塔尔能源公司北气田项目第二阶段的部分股权，此举旨在确保液化天然气（LNG）的稳定供应。【原文：Japan's Mitsui & Co is close to buying a stake in the second phase of QatarEnergy's massive North Field project as it seeks to secure stable liquefied natural gas (LNG) supply, five sources close to the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 汽车制造商Stellantis在2025年下半年因电动汽车业务收缩计提222亿欧元减值准备
item.description: Stellantis周五表示，由于这家法意合资汽车制造商缩减电动汽车开发计划并启动"战略转型"，去年下半年计提了约222亿欧元（265亿美元）的费用。【原文：Stellantis said on Friday it was booking charges of around 22.2 billion euros ($26.5 billion)in the second half of last year as the Franco-Italian automaker scales down electric-vehicle development plans and launches a "strategic shift".】

item.title: LG能源解决方案将收购Stellantis持有的加拿大合资企业股权
item.description: 韩国LG能源解决方案公司周五宣布，计划以象征性金额100美元收购Stellantis集团在加拿大电池合资企业所持的49%股权。【原文：South Korea's LG Energy Solution said on Friday it plans to buy the 49% stake held by Stellantis in their battery joint venture in Canada for a nominal amount of $100.】

item.title: 早间要闻：裁员潮加剧，美联储面临压力
item.description: 格雷戈尔·斯图尔特·亨特为您解析欧洲及全球市场今日展望。【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Gregor Stuart Hunter.】

item.title: 独家：英特尔、AMD通知中国客户CPU将面临长期等待
item.description: 知情人士透露，英特尔和AMD已通知中国客户，服务器中央处理器（CPU）供应短缺，英特尔警告称交货周期可能长达六个月。【原文：Intel and AMD have notified Chinese customers of supply shortages for server central processing units (CPUs), with Intel warning of delivery lead times of up to six months, people with knowledge of the delays said.】

item.title: 科技股领跌拖累亚洲股市；印尼股市因穆迪下调展望暴跌
item.description: 周五韩国股市延续跌势，投资者持续撤离科技股；与此同时，穆迪下调印尼信用评级展望后，印尼股市下跌逾2%，这对东南亚最大经济体又是一记重击。【原文：South Korean equities extended declines on Friday as investors continue to retreat from tech stocks, while Indonesian shares fell over 2% after Moody's lowered the country's credit rating outlook, the latest blow to Southeast Asia's largest economy.】

item.title: Toyota raises full-year operating profit outlook by 11.8%
item.description: 丰田汽车周五上调全年营业利润预期，因预计日元疲软和成本削减措施将提振业绩。【原文：Toyota Motor raised its full-year operating profit forecast on Friday, as it expects a weak yen and cost reduction efforts to lift its results.】

item.title: 丰田CEO佐藤将卸任，由CFO小池接任
item.description: 全球最大汽车制造商丰田汽车公司周五宣布，首席执行官佐藤孝司将卸任，由该公司首席财务官近藤健太接任。【原文：Toyota Motor Chief Executive Koji Sato will step down, the world's largest automaker said on Friday, and will be replaced by the automaker's chief financial officer, Kenta Kon.】

item.title: 供应链混乱成为航空业"新常态"，需求创历史新高
item.description: 高管和供应商表示，疫情爆发多年后，航空业仍在努力从供应链中断中恢复，而创纪录的乘客需求和地缘政治挑战加剧了这种中断。【原文：Years after the pandemic, the aviation industry is still struggling to recover from supply chain disruptions that have been exacerbated by record passenger demand and geopolitical challenges, executives and suppliers say.】
